meta.job_title: Special Education – Educational Assistant, Specialized Classroom

duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide instructional assistance to students under the direct supervision of a certified teacher.
Participate actively in the process of collecting specific data related to students’ behaviors and contribute to the development of students’ behavior support plans through sharing data.
Implement social skills instruction and behavior intervention plans specially designed by the teacher and behavior support staff utilizing crisis prevention and intervention strategies.
Utilize district-approved de-escalation and physical intervention techniques when needed in specialized and general education classroom settings.
Provide input into the development of individualized sensory plans for students; support students’ development of self-regulation ability through the skillful use of sensory tools.

Communicate with students during instruction and interpersonal interaction using language structure, tone, and body language that promotes positive student behavior, conflict resolution, and problem solving.
Meet students' physical, communication, and instructional needs by using adaptive equipment.
Perform health tasks and implement individualized protocols, as delegated by the medical staff and assigned by the classroom.
Assist in supervision of students in the classroom as well as other settings.
Work effectively with and respond to people from diverse cultures or backgrounds.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or equivalent required; two-years of college or associate’s degree preferred.
